concept.title: Field Hasher
concept.shortdesc: The Field Hasher processor uses an algorithm to encode values in a field. The Field Hasher can use MD5, SHA1 or SHA2 to hash field values.

conbody.p: Use the Field Hasher to securely encode sensitive data that you might want to decode at a later date. For example, you might use the Field Hasher to encode social security numbers.
When you configure the Field Hasher, you select the field that you want to encode and the algorithm that you want to use.
conbody.note: To hash non-string data, you might use the Field Type Converter processor to convert non-string data to String, then stream the data to the Field Hasher.
